title: There's actually an ingenious way to solve the whole FQC and Ap CDR crisis
body:
Just introduce http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/a/a5/Pox_Arcana_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235519 http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/4/40/Netherstride_Grimoire_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235734 and http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/d/d4/Rite_of_Ruin_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235733 to summoner's rift.

These three items, Pox Arcana, Netherstride Grimoire and Rite of Ruin were Black market brawler items who all had the same base stats of 100 ap, 100% mana regen and 20% CDR but had very diverse passives who catered towards a wide spectrum of AP mid laners.

Allowing us to build those in Summoner's rift would add diversity, give more CDR items with varying effects and maybe even make Mid laners stop building FQC in favor of getting these items with powerful stats and effects.

replies.body:
They might have to nerf the AP and possibly the passives as well since they do have good passives. Still would be cool to see them. Never really got to many chances to try them out honestly.

EDIT: Gonna add in the passives for each one, their respective stats, and gold efficiency for each which doesn't include the passive. I hope this helps.

Netherstride Grimoire http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/4/40/Netherstride_Grimoire_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235734 :

* Stats
 * +100% base mana regeneration
 * +100 ability power
 * +20% cooldown reduction

* Passive 
 * Unique – Malice: Gain 20% movement speed for 2 seconds whenever you deal ability damage.

* Netherstride Grimoire is 117.6% gold efficient without the passive. 

Rite of Ruin http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/d/d4/Rite_of_Ruin_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235733 :

* Stats
 * +100% base mana regeneration
 * +100 ability power
 * +20% cooldown reduction

* Passive
 * Unique – Razing: Gains charges upon moving or killing enemies, up to 300 charges. Attacking structures expends 50 charges to deal 100 (+15% AP) bonus true damage.

* Rite of Ruin is 117.6% gold efficient without the passive.

Pox Arcana http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/a/a5/Pox_Arcana_item.png/revision/latest?cb=20150707235519 :

* Stats
 * +100% base mana regeneration
 * +100 ability power
 * +20% cooldown reduction

* Passive
 * Unique – Pox: Applies a stack of Pox for 10 seconds whenever you deal ability damage, stacking up to 5 times.

* Active
 * Unique – Disease Harvest: Deals 100 magic damage plus 20 (+5% AP) per stack of Pox (maximum of 200 (+25% AP)) to all nearby enemies affected by Pox, and restores 5% of your maximum mana for every Pox stack harvested. 60 second cooldown.

* Pox Arcana is 117.6% gold efficient without the active.

Maybe if they blocked you out of buying more than 1 it could work. Having 2 items to full cdr as well as mana issues solved would be problematic.

{{item:3165}} {{item:3174}} 

2 items to full CDR and all Mana issues solved.

They'd need toning down for sure (AP and passives) but it'd be really cool to see them introduced as alternatives to Morellonomicon. They could change Morello's build path to use the Lost Chapter item they all build out of (also needs toning down) so they all have the same build path but all have different passives and therefore different uses. Could be a cool thing to add for the immobile mage update they're working on.
Yeah, I agree... I should probably add in that I think that even the passives need some tuning as well. I'm glad this is creating a civil discussion!

Reduce all of their AP to 80, to match {{item:3165}}.

However, Morellonomicon still only costs 2550, and is currently 121.3% gold efficient without the passive. They have to either raise the cost of Morellonomicon, which they most likely don't want to do, or reduce the cost of the Lost Chapter upgrades.

Make them all cost a flat 2600, and they'll have the same gold efficiency without their passives which would roughly be 119%.

Their uniques can frankly stay the same, except Razing. Netherstride Grimoire's Malice passive is basically just Black Cleaver's passive; and Pox is one of the most awesome actives for AoE mages, and encourages good positioning.

Razing works like a structure-specific Rapid Firecannon, but it should probably only generate up to maybe 100 charges, since it uses 50 for each hit on a structure. This will make it surpass RFC in structure damage in just two hits thanks to the AP scaling, but won't let mages just shred through a turret.

Lock out the Lost Chapter items after buying one, meaning you have to buy Morellonomicon, Unholy Grail, Nashor's Tooth or another CDR solution, and you won't be able to take advantage of their different unique effects.
nerf the mana regen . so people who dont use mana dont waste gold , and mana champs still have to buy {{item:3165}}
Why? One of the disadvantages to being manaless is that CDR itemisation sucks for you. Manaless champs have a ton of advantages for being manaless, why should they have zero disadvantages?

{{item:3142}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3071}} Oh boy, it sure sucks being a manaless AD champion these days, there's nowhere to get CDR.

The guys getting the shaft are the VERY FEW AP manaless champions: {{champion:85}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:68}}.

You're not wrong, there's no disadvantage to being a manaless AD. That's part of the reason why champs like Zed, Riven and Yasuo seem to break at the slightest change. I think this is an issue that needs to be addressed.

Yasuo? He doesn't even care about CDR, and he builds no CDR items unless he wants the item for something else.

His Q and his E aren't affected by CDR, and you won't build CDR just to have more windwalls.

This uninformed Yasuo hate has to stop.
Most ADCs are in the same boat - they wouldnt care about CDR at the expense of damage. Its just that Essence Reaver exists now, and ghostblade is pretty strong.

mentioning Yasuo as an AD midlaner who breaks at the slightest change isn't wrong though - even small changes have made Yasuo's viability fly around faster than his E does. Maybe you need to calm down.

It does not. There has not been any given time where Yasuo had a consistently high winrate on this game (maybe before his nerfs at the start of S4, but that's all).

But even if he did, they are explicitely mentioning that Yasuo breaks easily when CDR items get buffed, which is plainly wrong and it is what I was answering to.

>It does not. There has not been any given time where Yasuo had a consistently high winrate on this game

He was up at 52% with a near 100% P/B on the first patch of the preseason. With Warlords being buffed back up again there's potential for him to spike back up again.

Anyway I'd say this isn't that important, because Yasou's pick/ban rate fluctuates with his power more than his win rate. When Yasuo breaks his pick rate spikes to about 40%-60%, then his ban rate spikes to 80%-90%. This has happened time after time and the game essentially becomes 'ban Yasou or play the entire game pulling your hair out'.

>But even if he did, they are explicitely mentioning that Yasuo breaks easily when CDR items get buffed, which is plainly wrong and it is what I was answering to.

I actually didn't say that the break easily when CDR is buffed, maybe I implied it but I never said it. I said that he lacks any disadvantages to being manaless, this is not untrue. Yasuo would not be in any way benefited if he had mana.

Ok, you are right, you never said that CDR broke Yasuo, sorry.

52% winrate is just average, and about his pick/ban rate it's because of his fame, nothing more. From my personal experience, Yasuo is a noobstomper a la Master Yi or Katarina. People will always whine about him, people will play him whenever X pro says he's viable and people will ban him whenever he's popular.

getting CDR runes, investing 18 points in the cunning tree and building SV, WOta and Ionian boots makes him reach the CDR cap rather easily.

Only if you're AP. Manaless AD champs can buy bundles of CDR AND damage/defense casually.

Point is: should cdr be so much in mage itemization?

Cdr for mages is a multiplier like atk speed and crit for carries, and they already bring strong utility to the team.

To me is fair that they have to pick items that do not fit well their base builds ( lile support items ) if that is a good enough  tecnical choice, or if they want the utility given by the item.

It is just that FQC is too much powerfl overall for mages.

Probably an additional cdr item won' t be that bad, however.

I think because building attack speed is just more versatile and easier to build on items design-wise. It comes just easier to do and to assess, plus you don' t have the same cap for both attack speed and cdr so it comes natural that you have more attack speed sources than cdr.

Also, you forgot to mention {{item:3060}} which is very valuable but a bit of an underdog and {{item:3158}} that are universally applicable. Still, your point makes sense aniway. That' s why i said that an additional cdr item would not be that bad.

MR is cheaper and AP GOT MORE EXPENSIVE. AP got more expensive is his point

Actually, one of the point of the preseason changes, and the reason AP items got more expensive, was that those items generally were overly cost-efficient compared to the remaining armory.

Let's take Zhonya's, as an example. It has a **87.9%** cost efficiency. And a really powerful active effect, which is not calculated into these numbers.
Thornmail is another item with a powerful effect beyond its stats. It has **85.1%** cost efficiency.
Randuin's: 80% cost efficiency.
Dead Man's Plate, the current go-to Armor item: 83.3% efficient.
Righteous Glory: 95.5% cost efficient...but 600 gold is spent on mana.
Mercurial Scimitar: 98.1%. Used to be 92.7% before the addition of the Lifesteal (which I did not really understood).

And Rabadon's?
92.7% on its own. An extra 20% for every 100 AP you got from other sources. Needs 37 AP to be 100% efficient.
Infinity Edge: 96.5% + 5.6% for every 10% additional Crit Chance
Lord van Damm's Pillager: 96.5%.
I feel like those were really good and fun items, they would definetly need some tweaking but i'm in with the idea
I don't know if you guys realize it, but for the sake of the game riot does NOT want two items to give 40% cdr. Seriously, it's stupid. If you want cdr you should actively try to build for it.
